body.name: VICTIV 80" Camera Tripod, DSLR Tripod for Travel, Aluminum Heavy Duty Tripod Stand with 360° Ball Head, Camera Tripods & Monopods with Carry Bag, Professional Tripod for Canon Nikon -AT40 Orange
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 19 hrs 13 mins

features: 【Heavy Duty Tripod with Twist Locks】 Heavy Duty camera tripod with multiple adjustable features, including telescopic legs, flexible ball head and angle adjustment plate buckle. You can freely adjust the height, angle and direction as needed. Twist Lock Tripod is made of high-strength aluminum alloy with excellent compression resistance and durability. It can withstand the weight of heavy cameras and lenses, stably supporting the equipment and ensuring that it won't shake or tilt during shooting

【Panoramic Ball Head-36MM】Sturdy ball head allows 360-degree panoramic shots, elevation shot and top-down shot. U-shaped grooves offer the possibility of vertical shooting. Note: The large knob controls the free rotation of the sphere and the small knob controls the horizontal rotation of the head

【Macro Photography】 Camera Stand Tripod can be folded in reverse, easy to realize Macro Photography. You can adjust the length of the tripod legs according to the shooting needs, so as to adjust the shooting height from the ground, providing the right distance and angle for shooting different subjects
【Lowr Angle Photography】 Replace the tripod center column with a short 4-inch tube, and adjust the leg tube angle to the maximum for low angle shots

【Convert Professional Tripod to Monopod】 The Versatile Camera Tripod Stand features a removable center column and a detachable tripod leg. With a simple combination, they can be converted into a height-adjustable monopod (31"-81"). You can use the lightweight monopod as an alpenstock while hiking or walking

【Camera Tripod with Phone Holder】 Ball Head tripod with phone holder ( Rotatable 360°) can carry most cell phones： iPhone 14 13 12 11/11 Pro/XS Max/XS/XR/X/8/8 plus/ Galaxy Note 9/S10/S20. 1/4" screw tripod can carry DSLRs, compact video cameras, full-frame cameras, binoculars/Spotting Scope, cameras with lenses and digital cinema cameras, projectors, and laser levels. An additional quick release plate accessory can carry another device, offering the possibility of fast device switching

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Ball head tripod This ball head tripod has a precise head and a flexible ball head. The ball head is made of high-quality metal.The 36mm ball head is solid and very strong.By adjusting the knob, the ball head can be rotated to achieve horizontal, vertical and any angle shooting.The compact tripod head can be rotated 360 degrees horizontally to avoid frequent movement during shooting.This camera tripod is also equipped with an additional quick release plate to provide better accessory protection.

Lightweight camera tripod and compact tripod This compact camera tripod is very light, with a storage size of 18.5 inches and a weight of only 3.75 pounds. You can easily put it in a mountaineering bag, backpack, suitcase, and it will feel very light in your hand.The main material of this aluminum camera tripod is aluminum alloy, which has strong sturdiness and stability. This travel tripod can withstand a weight of 34 pounds.

Ergonomic Twist-locks The legs of this travel tripod are designed with aluminum tubes, which are sturdy and durable, with a smooth surface, waterproof and dirt-resistant.This professional tripod adopts a knob-style leg lock with greater locking force, which can tightly lock any position of the tripod leg, effectively preventing the tripod leg from sliding.This is a tripod that can carry heavy-duty cameras. It uses rubber feet to effectively prevent slippage. When you are shooting on uneven roads, it can also remain stable.

Angle lock , Foldable 180° Press the angle adjustment button to adjust the angle of the tripod legs. Twist Lock Rotate the twist lock. The leg tube can be released or tightened. Completely release the leg tube, and the tripod instantly becomes a tall tripod. Removable quick release plate The quick release plate can be quickly removed and installed.

a. Rotate the ball head and base(3/8'' screw included) out of the tripod body. b. Then attach the short tube on the center column by 3/8'' screw(in the packge). c. Finally install the ball head and base on the short tube by the 3/8'' screw(removed before).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Super sturdy. This thing feels really expensive and looks really expensive. If you are in need of a tripod/monopod that can reach ground level macro all the way up to about 7 feet tall this is for you. Great for those downward angle portraits. The one leg comes off easily to use as a monopod/hiking stick for quick sturdy photos on hikes or even just around town. The tripod also has many many different heights/angles. The legs can be set wide for outdoors landscape shots or narrow for crowded museum shots. Very easy to use as well. All fits in a nice little zip up travel bag. Pretty light but still has that expensive kinda weight to it. The color is really striking too. It has a level built in for even photos. Get this! Don’t bother with more expensive versions because the quality is the same as the ones that are hundreds of dollars. I use it with my Canon EOS Rebel T7 DSLR and multiple lenses including a very large 420mm-800mm telescopic lens. I friggin live this thing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars For the price, incredible piece of equipment
reviews.reviewText: I have no bad things to say about this item. I've payed a surprisingly low amount of money for a great, stury, versatile, and pretty lightweight item.For this price, I don't think you can get anything better elsewhere.It's pretty light, comes with a nice bag. The legs are pretty sturdy, and you can move around it a lot - the clips for the legs are well made.Do not expect the top of the line quality, its not it. But again, the price is great.Highly Recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Professional tripod here
reviews.reviewText: Excellent quality with all the possibilities unlocked. There is nothing you can't do with this one, very happy with the purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I purchased this recently since my older tripod has seen better days. I purchased this one specifically based on, what seemed like a good balance between features, price and apparent quality. It's a bit heavier than I anticipated; I wouldn't want to have to carry it backpacking, but it's fine for normal transporting. The quality seems to be fairly good, and I expect it will hold up well. I'm not sure the The legs are easy to adjust, and it collapses down surprisingly small for such a tall tripod. There only seem to be two "gotchas". The legs don't quite seem to be the same length when fully extended; the tripod sits at a slight angle, but they are easy to adjust. The only other issue is the levers that latch and secure the folding portion of the legs into place are a bit awkward to use. It seems as if they don't have a fixed pivot, requiring one to place a little bit of side pressure, in addition to the downward pressure to be able to open the latching mechanism and fold the legs. It just a little more effort to close up than I would have expected. The pivot and ball head seem to be pretty good and both have smooth action. It came with an extra quick release plate, which is nice, and it came with a phone mount bracket which seems okay. Additionally, it came with some small Allen wrenches, which I suppose are handy in the field if something begins to loosen. I'm not sure how I would feel trusting it to support a 30+ pound DSLR camera and lens at full height, or even close to full height, but then again if I had a camera +lens combo that weighed that much, I would probably NOT be buying a $59 tripod.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Especially if you are coming from some <$50 basic one, this is a serious upgrade in terms of weight, sterdiness and functions. All the knobs and tightening clamps are super easy to use and manage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The overall ruggedness and simplicity was evident.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I love the overall functionality of this product with the spin dials for extension and securement. Also, the threading on this Victor tripod was made of good metal and fastening attachments was smooth. I also enjoyed the overall metal alloy, unlike other tripods, whom have a combination of plastic to metal, which Can become a hindrance in rugged terrain.I noted the durability of this product due to my utilization in mountaineering, and overall use in content creation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good design and quality
reviews.reviewText: Got this for light duty use and there’s not much else one could ask for on this. All the slides are smooth, the locking works well, the waist feels durable. It is lightweight and if you put a nice camera on it, you’ll want to add a bag weight at the bottom to keep it stable.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A decent tripod for the money.
reviews.reviewText: This tripod is a decent value for the money. It adjusts well and is easily transformed into a monopod if you’d rather not take the whole thing with you. All of the features seem fairly sturdy and everything adjusts and locks easily.***Edit; After having it for three months, and using it quite a bit, I feel like this tripod is not quite as stable as it could be. I realize it’s a budget tripod, but it’s fairly wobbly. In particular the center column, to which attaches the ball-head, is particularly flimsy.Your mileage may vary.
Sehr stabil, gute Verarbeitung und bietet viele Verrstellmöglichkeiten. Sehr kompakt zusammen zulegen und in der Tasche gut zu transportieren.
Trépied qui fait le job à merveille, très stable et la sensation de qualité en main est bluffante.

reviews.reviewTitle: Goede tripod maar middenkolom zit snel geblokkeerd
reviews.reviewText: Over het algemeen heel sterke strugge tripod voor de rpijs maar de middenkolom zit snel vast waardoor deze soms niet te verstellen is en ik thuis met een hamer hem er moet proberen uit te slaan. Hier ben ik wat teleurgesteld door.

Das Stativ dient mir als Halterung für meine Surround Mikrofon-Systeme. Diese bringen schon mal 8 kg (inkl. Kabel) auf die Waage. Daher brauchte ich ein Stativ, das diese Last ohne Probleme trägt.Zunächst habe ich nur eins gekauft und ausgiebig getestet. So habe ich einen Eimer (10 l) mit Wasser gefüllt und mit einem Brett darunter auf den Kopf des Stativs bei maximaler Höhe (205 cm!) gestellt.Selbst bei böigem Wind hat das Stativ alles souverän "gestanden".Das man es mit ein paar Griffen in ein One-Pole Stativ verwandeln kann, findet ich wirklich super!Denn häufig sind sog. "Drehgenehmigungen" fällig, wenn "das Stativ den Boden berührt!" (O-Ton). Nun, mit einem One-Pole auf den Fuß gestellt, berührt das Stativ definitiv nicht den Boden => keine Drehgenehmigung fällig. ;-)Schön finde ich, daß man das Stativ sehr schnell auf- und abbauen kann, die Arretierungen sicher einrasten und halten. Zusammengeklappt ist es wirklich sehr kompakt und mit rund 1,8 kg zwar kein Leichtgewicht, aber wenn etwas das 5,5-fache seines Eigengewichtes tragen kann, muss es halt etwas stabiler gebaut sein.Sehr hilfreich ist auch der kleine Haken unten an der Mittelstange der ausfahrbaren Stange. Hier kann man eine Tasche oder Rucksack anhängen und den Schwerpunkt des Stativs noch ein Stück weiter nach unten verlagern, was zusätzliche Stabilität bedeutet.Wenn ich an meine Mikrofon-Systeme noch die für Außenaufnahmen erforderlichen Windschutze anbringe, wird die Angriffsfläche für den Wind noch größer. Sobald das System dann hin und her wackelt, ergeben sich Phasing Effekte auf den Aufnahmen, die sie ruinieren.Mit diesem Stativ bewegt sich nichts mehr im Wind und als sich dann doch etwas zu bewegen begann, habe ich aus Sorge, daß mir dicke Äste aus den Bäumen auf den Kopf fallen abgebrochen. Andere Leute nennen das Starkwind oder fast schon Sturm.Ich finde das Stativ so gut, daß ich mir schon ein zweites gekauft habe.Ein Detail möchte ich noch besonders herausheben: Die Universal-Schnellwechselplatte! Sehr solide und die Arretierung ist schnell zu lösen und hält alles sicher am Platz. Das mitgelieferte Werkzeug-Set ist hilfreich, besonders wenn man wie ich die beiden kleinen Sicherungsschrauben an den schmalen Ende der Universal-Schnellwechselplatte nicht benötigt.Alles in Allem: Klare Kaufempfehlung für Leute, die schwerere Lasten (10+ kg) sicher am Platz halten wollen!

Ce trépied est vraiment léger, c'est sa force. Le fait de pouvoir en extraire un monopode est vraiment un plus qui peut se révéler pratique et évite d'avoir les deux séparés à promener ou d'avoir à choisir lequel prendre. Cela prend un peu de temps et d'habitude pour récupérer le monopode mais on s'y fait. Je ne suis pas un fan des bagues pour bloquer les pieds mais je sais par expérience qu'elles résistent mieux au temps que l'autre système (dont j'ignore le nom)
